content: On August 20, 1973, the Atlanta Braves faced the San Francisco Giants in a game that showcased the power of Hall of Famer Hank Aaron. In this matchup, Aaron hit his 700th career home run, becoming just the third player in MLB history to reach that milestone, joining Babe Ruth and Willie Mays. This moment not only solidified Aaron's legacy as one of baseball's greatest sluggers but also marked a significant achievement in Braves history as he continued to make history with the franchise.
